FuncDef:
The dmr-prefix command sets a default mapping rule (DMR) IPv6 prefix on a BR.
The undo dmr-prefix command deletes a DMR IPv6 prefix.
By default, no DMR IPv6 prefix is configured.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a DMR IPv6 prefix name.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 characters.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
To set a DMR IPv6 prefix on a BR, run the dmr-prefix command in the MAP-T instance view. The prefix is used to verify and encapsulate MAP packets.
Precautions
A single IPv6 prefix can be set for each DMR.The IPv6 prefix address is mutually exclusive with an interface IP address, an address in a BRAS address pool, a NAT64 prefix address, DS-Lite local IPv6 address.
